trans-unit.source: Publish a Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish a Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to convert a training experiment to a scoring experiment, prepare it for publishing, then publish it as an Azure Machine Learning web service.
trans-unit.target: How to convert a training experiment to a scoring experiment, prepare it for publishing, then publish it as an Azure Machine Learning web service.

trans-unit.source: Publish an Azure Machine Learning web service
trans-unit.target: Publish an Azure Machine Learning web service

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning enables you to build, test, and deploy predictive analytics solutions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning enables you to build, test, and deploy predictive analytics solutions.

trans-unit.source: From a high-level point-of-view, this is done in three steps:
trans-unit.target: From a high-level point-of-view, this is done in three steps:

trans-unit.source: **[Create a training experiment]** - Azure Machine Learning Studio is a collaborative visual development environment that you use to train and test a predictive analytics model using training data that you supply.
trans-unit.target: **[Create a training experiment]** - Azure Machine Learning Studio is a collaborative visual development environment that you use to train and test a predictive analytics model using training data that you supply.

trans-unit.source: **[Convert it to a scoring experiment]** - Once your model has been trained with existing data and you're ready to use it to score new data, you prepare and streamline your experiment for scoring.
trans-unit.target: **[Convert it to a scoring experiment]** - Once your model has been trained with existing data and you're ready to use it to score new data, you prepare and streamline your experiment for scoring.

trans-unit.source: **[Publish it as a web service]** - With just a click, you can publish your scoring experiment as an Azure web service.
trans-unit.target: **[Publish it as a web service]** - With just a click, you can publish your scoring experiment as an Azure web service.

trans-unit.source: Users can send data to your model and receive your model's predictions.
trans-unit.target: Users can send data to your model and receive your model's predictions.

trans-unit.source: Once you've published the web service, you can:
trans-unit.target: Once you've published the web service, you can:

trans-unit.source: **[Access]** it through the web service API
trans-unit.target: **[Access]** it through the web service API

trans-unit.source: **[Manage]** it through the Azure management portal, and
trans-unit.target: **[Manage]** it through the Azure management portal, and

trans-unit.source: **[Update]** it if your model changes
trans-unit.target: **[Update]** it if your model changes

trans-unit.source: Create a training experiment
trans-unit.target: Create a training experiment

trans-unit.source: To train a predictive analytics model, you use Azure Machine Learning Studio to create a training experiment where you include various modules to load training data, prepare the data as necessary, apply machine learning algorithms, and evaluate the results.
trans-unit.target: To train a predictive analytics model, you use Azure Machine Learning Studio to create a training experiment where you include various modules to load training data, prepare the data as necessary, apply machine learning algorithms, and evaluate the results.

trans-unit.source: You can iterate on an experiment and try different machine learning algorithms to compare and evaluate the results.
trans-unit.target: You can iterate on an experiment and try different machine learning algorithms to compare and evaluate the results.

trans-unit.source: The process of creating and managing training experiments is covered more thoroughly elsewhere - see these articles for more information and examples:
trans-unit.target: The process of creating and managing training experiments is covered more thoroughly elsewhere - see these articles for more information and examples:

trans-unit.source: Create a simple experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Create a simple experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Develop a predictive solution with Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Develop a predictive solution with Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Import your training data into Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Manage experiment iterations in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Manage experiment iterations in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Convert the training experiment to a scoring experiment
trans-unit.target: Convert the training experiment to a scoring experiment

trans-unit.source: Once you've trained your model, you're ready to use it to score new data.
trans-unit.target: Once you've trained your model, you're ready to use it to score new data.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you convert your training experiment into a scoring experiment.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you convert your training experiment into a scoring experiment.

trans-unit.source: By converting to a scoring experiment, you're getting your trained model ready to be published as a scoring web service.
trans-unit.target: By converting to a scoring experiment, you're getting your trained model ready to be published as a scoring web service.

trans-unit.source: Users of the web service will send input data to your model and your model will send back the prediction results.
trans-unit.target: Users of the web service will send input data to your model and your model will send back the prediction results.

trans-unit.source: So as you convert to a scoring experiment you will want to keep in mind how you expect your model to be used by others.
trans-unit.target: So as you convert to a scoring experiment you will want to keep in mind how you expect your model to be used by others.

trans-unit.source: Convert to scoring experiment
trans-unit.target: Convert to scoring experiment

trans-unit.source: For more details on how to do this conversion, see [Convert a Machine Learning training experiment to a scoring experiment](machine-learning-convert-training-experiment-to-scoring-experiment.md)
trans-unit.target: For more details on how to do this conversion, see [Convert a Machine Learning training experiment to a scoring experiment](machine-learning-convert-training-experiment-to-scoring-experiment.md)

trans-unit.source: Publish the scoring experiment as a web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the scoring experiment as a web service

trans-unit.source: Now that the scoring experiment has been sufficiently prepared, you can publish it as an Azure web service.
trans-unit.target: Now that the scoring experiment has been sufficiently prepared, you can publish it as an Azure web service.

trans-unit.source: Using the web service, users can send data to your model and the model will return its predictions.
trans-unit.target: Using the web service, users can send data to your model and the model will return its predictions.

trans-unit.source: To publish your scoring experiment, click **Run** at the bottom of the experiment canvas, then click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE**.
trans-unit.target: To publish your scoring experiment, click **Run** at the bottom of the experiment canvas, then click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE**.

trans-unit.source: The web service is set up and you are placed in the web service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The web service is set up and you are placed in the web service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Publish the web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the web service

trans-unit.source: To test the web service, click the **Test** link in the **DASHBOARD** tab.
trans-unit.target: To test the web service, click the **Test** link in the **DASHBOARD** tab.

trans-unit.source: A dialog pops up to ask you for the input data for the service.
trans-unit.target: A dialog pops up to ask you for the input data for the service.

trans-unit.source: These are the columns expected by the scoring experiment.
trans-unit.target: These are the columns expected by the scoring experiment.

trans-unit.source: Enter a set of data and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a set of data and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The results generated by the web service are displayed at the bottom of the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The results generated by the web service are displayed at the bottom of the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Test the web service
trans-unit.target: Test the web service

trans-unit.source: On the **CONFIGURATION** tab you can change the display name of the service and give it a description.
trans-unit.target: On the **CONFIGURATION** tab you can change the display name of the service and give it a description.

trans-unit.source: The name and description is displayed in the Azure Management Portal where you manage your web services.
trans-unit.target: The name and description is displayed in the Azure Management Portal where you manage your web services.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable logging to diagnose any failures that you're seeing when hitting your web service.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable logging to diagnose any failures that you're seeing when hitting your web service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable logging for Machine Learning web services](machine-learning-web-services-logging.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable logging for Machine Learning web services](machine-learning-web-services-logging.md).

trans-unit.source: Configure the web service
trans-unit.target: Configure the web service

trans-unit.source: You can also provide a description for your input data, output data, and web service parameters by providing entering a string for each column under **INPUT SCHEMA**, **OUTPUT SCHEMA**, and **WEB SERVICE PARAMETER**.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide a description for your input data, output data, and web service parameters by providing entering a string for each column under **INPUT SCHEMA**, **OUTPUT SCHEMA**, and **WEB SERVICE PARAMETER**.

trans-unit.source: These descriptions are used in the sample code documentation provided for the web service.
trans-unit.target: These descriptions are used in the sample code documentation provided for the web service.

trans-unit.source: Access the web service
trans-unit.target: Access the web service

trans-unit.source: Once you publish your web service from Machine Learning Studio, you can send data to the service and receive responses programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Once you publish your web service from Machine Learning Studio, you can send data to the service and receive responses programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The dashboard provides all the information you need to access your web service.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard provides all the information you need to access your web service.

trans-unit.source: For example, the API key is provided to allow authorized access to the service, and API help pages are provided to help you get started writing your code.
trans-unit.target: For example, the API key is provided to allow authorized access to the service, and API help pages are provided to help you get started writing your code.

trans-unit.source: For more information about accessing a Machine Learning web service, see [How to consume a published Azure Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about accessing a Machine Learning web service, see [How to consume a published Azure Machine Learning web service](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).

trans-unit.source: Manage the web service in the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Manage the web service in the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, you can manage your web services by clicking the **Machine Learning** service, opening your Machine Learning workspace, and then opening the web service from the **WEB SERVICES** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, you can manage your web services by clicking the **Machine Learning** service, opening your Machine Learning workspace, and then opening the web service from the **WEB SERVICES** tab.

trans-unit.source: From this page you can monitor the web service, update it, and delete it.
trans-unit.target: From this page you can monitor the web service, update it, and delete it.

trans-unit.source: You can also add a second endpoint for your web service in addition to the default endpoint that is created when you publish it.
trans-unit.target: You can also add a second endpoint for your web service in addition to the default endpoint that is created when you publish it.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Manage an Azure Machine Learning workspace](machine-learning-manage-workspace.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Manage an Azure Machine Learning workspace](machine-learning-manage-workspace.md).

trans-unit.source: Update the web service
trans-unit.target: Update the web service

trans-unit.source: You can make changes to your web service, such as updating the model with additional training data, and publish it again, overwriting the original web service.
trans-unit.target: You can make changes to your web service, such as updating the model with additional training data, and publish it again, overwriting the original web service.

trans-unit.source: To update the web service, open the original scoring experiment you used to publish the original web service and make an editable copy by clicking **SAVE AS**.
trans-unit.target: To update the web service, open the original scoring experiment you used to publish the original web service and make an editable copy by clicking **SAVE AS**.

trans-unit.source: Make your changes and then click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE**.
trans-unit.target: Make your changes and then click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE**.

trans-unit.source: Because you've published this experiment before, Machine Learning Studio prompts you to ask if you want to overwrite the existing service.
trans-unit.target: Because you've published this experiment before, Machine Learning Studio prompts you to ask if you want to overwrite the existing service.

trans-unit.source: If you click **YES**, then the existing web service is stopped and the new scoring experiment is published in its place.
trans-unit.target: If you click **YES**, then the existing web service is stopped and the new scoring experiment is published in its place.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you made configuration changes in the original web service, for example, entering a new display name or description, you will need to enter those values again.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you made configuration changes in the original web service, for example, entering a new display name or description, you will need to enter those values again.

trans-unit.source: One option for updating your web service is to retrain the model programmatically.
trans-unit.target: One option for updating your web service is to retrain the model programmatically.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Retrain Machine Learning models programmatically](machine-learning-retrain-models-programmatically.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Retrain Machine Learning models programmatically](machine-learning-retrain-models-programmatically.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
